pull.title: Add whitelistforcerelay to control forced relaying. [#7099 redux]
pull.body:
Also renames whitelistalwaysrelay.

Nodes relay all transactions from whitelisted peers, this
 gets in the way of some useful reasons for whitelisting
 peers-- for example, bypassing bandwidth limitations.

The purpose of this forced relaying is for specialized gateway
 applications where a node is being used as a P2P connection
 filter and multiplexer, but where you don't want it getting
 in the way of (re-)broadcast.

This change makes it configurable with whitelistforcerelay.

events.message:
Add whitelistforcerelay to control forced relaying.

Also renames whitelistalwaysrelay.

Nodes relay all transactions from whitelisted peers, this
 gets in the way of some useful reasons for whitelisting
 peers-- for example, bypassing bandwidth limitations.

The purpose of this forced relaying is for specialized gateway
 applications where a node is being used as a P2P connection
 filter and multiplexer, but where you don't want it getting
 in the way of (re-)broadcast.

This change makes it configurable with whitelistforcerelay.

issue.title: Add whitelistforcerelay setting [PR changed to no longer default to off.]
issue.body:
Previously the node would relay all transactions from whitelisted
 peers, including invalid ones which will cause instant bannind.

This is a pretty big footgun.

It also gets in the way of some useful reasons for whitelisting
 peers-- for example, bypassing bandwidth limitations.

The purpose of this forced relaying is for specialized gateway
 applications where a node is being used as a P2P connection
 filter and multiplexer, but where you don't want it getting
 in the way of broadcast.  People doing this know they're doing
 this, so this change makes it a setting and defaults it to off.

events.body: Travis is failing, but I cannot quite see why.

issue.title: [0.13] Missing patches from 0.12
issue.body: Several patches missed `master` somehow. This pull will sync `master` with `0.12`.

issue.title: Bitcoin 0.12 P2P/Net PRs 1
issue.body:
Cherry-picked from the following upstream PRs:

- bitcoin/bitcoin#7129
  - Zcash equivalent of BIP 130
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7133
  - Just the last commit (the rest is in zcash/zcash#4997)
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7482

Part of #2074. Part of #2352.

issue.title: Some instructions required
issue.body:
First of all, thanks for the wonderful project and sorry for publishing this question in "Issues"-directories. I didnt found bitcoinfibre-mailing list.
 Could you give me some more detailed instructions for installation and configuration? Should I first install Bitcoin ( from this source https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin) and then Bitcoinfibre? Or works Bitcoinfibre independently, after installation from Bitcoinfibre-Source?
That is what i have done.
1. I installed required dependencies and Berkeley 4.8. 
2. Then i cloned Bitcoinfibre from this git-scource.
3. Then 
$ ./autogen.sh
$ ./configure
$ make -j4
$ sudo make install

After that i ran 
$ bitcoind -fecreaddevice=/tmp/async_rx
in order to listen pipe-file "async_rx". But i was not able to establish connection (see below)
![32689479-21b48298-c6e6-11e7-9193-8a162d0155d0](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30798903/32800586-05aebe82-c97b-11e7-94c7-f1bb5fc183f0.png)

The same behavior showed program with "-udpport=54321" -argument 
when i ran it in order to listen udp port #54321 
Could you please provide an example from bitcoin.conf that adjusted to fec- or udp-interface? 
What can cause that problem?
Thanks in advance.

issue.title: net: Remove -whitelistrelay
issue.body:
This removes an option that has no documented use case.

The option is on by default and can either be disabled directly or by setting `-blocksonly` (an undocumented debug option). Instead of disabling `-whitelistrelay` to not accept txs from whitelisted peers, the user shouldn't whitelist peers in the first place.

issue.title: Add -blocksonly option
issue.body:
Cherry-picked from the following upstream PRs:

- bitcoin/bitcoin#6993
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7046
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6780
  - The third commit (we backported the rest in #2390).
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7126
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7439
- bitcoin/bitcoin#15990
  - Only the `-blocksonly` documentation changes.
- bitcoin/bitcoin#16555
- bitcoin/bitcoin#18391
  - Only the `-blocksonly` documentation changes.

Part of #2074.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -752,13 +753,19 @@ void InitParameterInteraction()
 
     // disable walletbroadcast and whitelistalwaysrelay in blocksonly mode
comments.body: You'd need to make the rename globally; Also, I don't like that this just ignores    `-whitelistalwaysrelay` set in old `.conf` files.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -752,13 +753,19 @@ void InitParameterInteraction()
 
     // disable walletbroadcast and whitelistalwaysrelay in blocksonly mode
comments.body: Valid point, although how old can these conf files be, given that `whitelistalwaysrelay` was introduced in #6993 only two months ago, so isn't in any releases.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -752,13 +753,19 @@ void InitParameterInteraction()
 
     // disable walletbroadcast and whitelistalwaysrelay in blocksonly mode
comments.body:
I guess there are three options:
- Silently accept both variations
- Ignore
- Add it to the blacklist https://github.com/gmaxwell/bitcoin/blob/325c725fb6205e38142914acb9ed1733d8482d46/src/init.cpp#L892-L903
